message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of optimizing the allocation of tasks to volunteers on a crowdsourcing platform, which is a classic problem in game theory (cs.GT) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The authors also propose randomized policies to solve the problem, which involves designing algorithms and analyzing their performance, making it relevant to the subfield of machine learning (cs.LG). The problem also involves dealing with time-varying distributions and stochastic processes, which are topics in statistics and data science (cs.DS). Finally, the authors collaborate with a food recovery platform, which suggests that the paper may be relevant to the subfield of social and information networks (cs.SI).
